description_txt: stated on May 21, 2011 in a speech at the state GOP convention:
quote_txt: One of every two Wisconsin residents are "on some kind of government handout."

description_txt: stated on May 3, 2011 in a press availability following a policy luncheon:
quote_txt: "The (health reform) legislation which Washington passed last year has made it more difficult to hire" because it’s increased costs for employers.

description_txt: stated on May 19, 2011 in a statement.:
quote_txt: Says that several times in the last 15 years, Austin City Council candidates have won seats after trailing by more than 4,000 votes in the election prompting the runoff.

description_txt: stated on May 17, 2011 in an advertisement:
quote_txt: The Paul Ryan budget proposal would "privatize Medicare."

description_txt: stated on May 17, 2011 in an advertisement:
quote_txt: The Paul Ryan budget proposal would leave the country "without Medicare."

description_txt: stated on May 20, 2011 in an interview.:
quote_txt: For more than 30 years after World War II, there was a steady reduction in U.S. debt as a percentage of gross domestic product.

description_txt: stated on May 21, 2011 in in a speech announcing his presidential run:
quote_txt: In the U.S. Constitution, "there’s a little section in there that talks about life, liberty and the pursuit of happiness."

description_txt: stated on May 23, 2011 in a speech to announce his presidential candidacy:
quote_txt: "For decades before I was elected, governors tried and failed to get Minnesota out of the top 10 highest-taxed states in the country. I actually did it."

description_txt: stated on May 19, 2011 in a tweet:
quote_txt: "750 days since Bill Nelson & the Democrats in the Senate passed a budget. How can this be justified?"

description_txt: stated on May 19, 2011 in comments to reporters.:
quote_txt: Says his barehanded catch posted on YouTube is real.

description_txt: stated on May 16, 2011 in a fundraising letter:
quote_txt: Compact fluorescent light bulbs are "toxic" and "not environmentally friendly."

description_txt: stated on May 10, 2011 in a radio interview.:
quote_txt: Says Gov. Rick Perry has been "begging" for the federal government to send the Coast Guard to patrol two lakes on the U.S.-Mexico border.

description_txt: stated on May 21, 2011 in a speech announcing his presidential run:
quote_txt: The U.S. has "47 million people on food stamps. That’s 14 million more than when the current occupant of the White House took over."

description_txt: stated on May 5, 2011 in at a rally at the Ohio Statehouse:
quote_txt: "To give a sense of how families are struggling, a record four out of every 10 school kids in Ohio now qualifies for subsidized lunch."

description_txt: stated on May 15, 2011 in an interview:
quote_txt: The Providence teacher contract "is one of the longest in the country."
footer: By C. Eugene Emery Jr. • May 24, 2011

description_txt: stated on May 23, 2011 in a guest column published in the 'St. Petersburg Times':
quote_txt: "Early voting remains at 96 hours."

description_txt: stated on May 18, 2011 in a Web ad:
quote_txt: "Unions don’t have to comply with Obamacare."

description_txt: stated on May 23, 2011 in a public appearance and an op-ed:
quote_txt: On whether he would vote for the budget proposed by Rep. Paul Ryan, R-Wis.

description_txt: stated on May 16, 2011 in a fundraising letter:
quote_txt: "The new light bulbs will cost roughly six times the cost of the light bulbs we now use."

description_txt: stated on April 26, 2011 in interviews and testimony about the bill:
quote_txt: Deregulation of the state’s telecommunications industry will create 50,000 jobs in Wisconsin.

description_txt: stated on April 19, 2011 in a news release.:
quote_txt: The U.S. has "over $62 trillion in unfunded liabilities."

description_txt: stated on May 9, 2011 in an article in Politico:
quote_txt: "A gallon (of gasoline) delivered to the front lines for our troops in Afghanistan cost more than $400."

description_txt: stated on May 17, 2011 in a press release.:
quote_txt: "The turnout on May 14th was just 7 percent -- the lowest turnout in decades."

description_txt: stated on May 17, 2011 in website article:
quote_txt: "Tommy Thompson wanted to implant data chips in humans."

description_txt: stated on April 26, 2011 in a tweet.:
quote_txt: "Gas prices have gone up $2 since Obama took office."

description_txt: stated on May 4, 2011 in a news release:
quote_txt: "No other Northeastern state has passed a photo ID law"

description_txt: stated on May 7, 2011 in a speech.:
quote_txt: "If you take the population growth here in Virginia, we are net zero on job creation since (Bob McDonnell) became governor."

description_txt: stated on May 5, 2011 in a presidential debate:
quote_txt: "The Arab and the Muslim nations get twice as much money as Israel."

description_txt: stated on May 17, 2011 in an interview on "The Colbert Report":
quote_txt: "We bring in enough tax revenue to service our debt, pay for Medicare and Medicaid and Social Security, and then still have about $300 (billion) or $400 billion left over."

description_txt: stated on May 10, 2011 in a tweet:
quote_txt: " 'Scary' fact about our national debt. In 1791 it was $75 million. Today, it rises by that amount in about an hour."
